Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centres above two white bands with thin red band between; exterior: painted decoration consisting of siren (part of wing with red patch, body with dotted scale pattern and tail feathers), to left.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the siren, see Lemos 1991, pl. 88, no. 675 from Pitane.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 264, no. 555, pl. 68)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0512) (phase 2)
